title.narrative: Rural Economic Development in Southern Georgia (2011-2017)

description.narrative: The programme supports economic growth and reduces poverty in rural areas of Kvemo-Kartli and Samtskhe-Javakheti by supporting the private sector, including two of the most important value chains in the region: potato farming and the dairy industry. The programme consists of three components: 1) Financing of investments in new technology (machinery, tools, etc.) through a grant facility. 50% of the total grant is provided whereas the remaining 50% is self-financed e.g. through a bank loan. 2) Capacity development in the potato value-chain aimed at introducing more efficient production, storage, processing and packaging methods. 3) Capacity development in the dairy and livestock value-chains aimed at introducing more efficient production, storage, processing and packaging methods. For 2) and 3) are strengthening of better hygiene in production and processing to improve Georgia's access to the EU market by complying with EU standards the goal. The Swiss Agency for Development and Cooperation (SDC) is responsible for implementation of the programme.
